data.title: The Great Gildersleeve – Forgotten Films
data.meta_description: Posts about The Great Gildersleeve written by thesquonk
data.text:
One of my favorite film discoveries of last year was The Great Gildersleeve, the first of a series of four films to bring Harold Peary’s famous radio character to the big screen. I’ve enjoyed old-time radio programs since I was a kid so seeing one turned into a film was very intriguing for me. Having... Continue Reading →

Last summer, an associate and I had to drive from Colorado to Ohio for a conference and then back again. We found that we both enjoyed listening to old-time radio shows and so, for much of the trip, the satellite radio was tuned to the old-time radio station. The program that seemed to be on... Continue Reading →

We've got just two new theatrical releases from the Warner Archive this week. There are several TV releases, including the Ed Grimley animated series, but we just cover the movie releases here. Still, I'm pretty excited about the films being released this week because one of the releases is a five film set that I... Continue Reading →
